title: Drake breaks Ed Sheeran's new album record on Spotify
text: Entertainment News Drake breaks Ed Sheeran's new album record on Spotify A Spotify spokeswoman says that 'More Life' was played 61,302,082 times on the first full day it was released Published 10:54 AM, March 21, 2017 Updated 10:54 AM, March 21, 2017 'MORE LIFE.' Drake beats Ed Sheeran's record for most played album on Spotify. Screengrab from Instagram/@champagnepapi NEW YORK, USA – Drake's new album has set a record for the best first day on Spotify, edging out Ed Sheeran who held the title for a mere two weeks. The Toronto hip-hop star on Saturday, March 18 dropped More Life , a 22-song collection that ventures deeper into the dancehall sounds of Jamaica and features appearances by other leading rappers. A Spotify spokeswoman said that More Life was played 61,302,082 times on its first full day Sunday, March 19 topping the 56,727,861 streams on March 3 for English songwriter Sheeran's Divide . Spotify, the world's largest streaming platform, has some 100 million listeners including on its free tier. Drake also broke the record for the most overall streams by an artist on a single day, again beating Sheeran. Tracking service Nielsen Music separately forecast that More Life would make the biggest debut so far this year on the Billboard chart of US album sales. The success of More Life comes even though Drake has described it as a "playlist" to hold time between releases of full-fledged albums. Unlike his album Views last year, Drake released More Life immediately on all streaming platforms rather than giving an initial exclusive to Apple Music, with which he has a close relationship. Spotify records have repeatedly been broken as a growing number of listeners turn to streaming, which allows unlimited, on-demand music online. – Rappler.com HOW DOES THIS STORY MAKE YOU FEEL? Happy
